utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Good morning.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m surprised you’re up, given how late you got in from L.A. last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Well, I thought we could play a little catch-up before you got off to work. Oh!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m all yours. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Careful. I made it a little strong this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, that will wake the dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It would certainly make your job a lot easier. One interview, “he’s the guy who killed me”, case closed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I am guessing that you found out something about your missing time and that’s what you want to catch up with me on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh – actually, yeah, actually, I did. Um … but I was thinking, how about we eat first?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. Wow. That bad?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Knock knock! Are you decent?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, welcome home, darling.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, what a pleasant surprise. You know – you – you could have called first.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, I didn’t want to disturb you in case you wanted to sleep in. Oh, darling, I thought I would just sneak in and make my boy a little breakfast. Oh, well, phooey. You beat me to it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I, well –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You expecting someone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, just old habits. So did you really come just to make me breakfast? Because that does not sound like you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, pish posh. Actually, I just got an advance copy of my book that I wanted you to see.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unsolicited Advice by Martha Rodgers. Mother, I am so proud of you!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, thank you. Read the dedication.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ”For Richard”. “Without your constant stumbles in life the advice in this book would not have been possible.” Constant stumbles?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Let’s not make this about you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It – – one second. Hey! Where are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hallway. I uh, snuck out through the bedroom. That would be the height of irony, huh? We managed to successfully hide our relationship from LokSat only to get outed by your mom. Look, do you want me to sneak back at lunch so we can talk about what you found?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, okay, that’s – I’ll see you tonight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Listen, I gotta go. I love you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So I just wanted to say –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, guys, what’ve we got?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right now our victim is a John Doe. There’s no phone or ID on the victim but we’ve scanned his prints and we’re running them now.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: From the blood trail it looks like he was shot around the corner and collapsed here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’m still not sure why you needed the captain to come down.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARRISH
utterance.content: Our victim was shot in the back. He bled out within a few minutes, then the killer took the time and the risk to cut out the bullet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Obviously our killer was worried that ballistics would lead back to him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means the gun’s already in the system. Do you have a time of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Between 9 and midnight.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Got a hit on the fingerprint match. Our victim’s name is Daniel Bardot. He’s a recruit officer at the NYPD Academy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s one of us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I got Bardot’s phone records, but unfortunately the GPS was turned off on his cell so we still don’t know what he was doing in that neighborhood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about calls?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Last call he made was at 5:30 to a law firm in Midtown. Only lasted a minute. Vikram’s checking it out.

utterance.speaker: TRAINING OFFICER
utterance.content: My Granny’s stronger than all three of you guys combined!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bad flashbacks, bro.

utterance.speaker: TRAINING OFFICER
utterance.content: You gotta want it!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Pushups were the answer to everything around this place. Police work is more than just strength and endurance. It’s about intellectual rigor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, come on, you guys. It wasn’t all that bad here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Says the Academy All Star. Oh, look. Recruit Officer Beckett … Recruit Officer Beckett … oh, Recruit Officer Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to go download with the Academy commissioner. You guys head over to Bardot’s dorm room. There’s gotta be a clue here as to who his killer is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi, Deputy Commissioner Malone, I’m Kate Beckett.

utterance.speaker: DEPUTY COMMISSIONER MALONE
utterance.content: Captain, nice to finally meet you. You’re a bit of a legend around these parts. Recruits have been gunning for your records since I got here five years ago. So far no one’s gotten close.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, they will. Every record falls in the end.

utterance.speaker: MALONE
utterance.content: Here’s Bardot’s file. I’ve assigned his instructor, Sergeant Ortiz, to be your liaison. You know Sergeant Ortiz.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I do. He was my instructor when I was here. His tough love is the reason why my name’s on all of those plaques out there.

utterance.speaker: MALONE
utterance.content: Come in, Sergeant.

utterance.speaker: SERGEANT ORTIZ
utterance.content: Thank you, sir.

utterance.speaker: SERGEANT ORTIZ
utterance.content: Captain Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s so good to see you, Sergeant. So what can you tell me about Daniel Bardot?

utterance.speaker: MALONE
utterance.content: He was an admirable kid. Got a rough start in life. His parents were killed in a robbery when he was nine.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: That’s not surprising when you grow up in Hunt’s Point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Irish mafia’s backyard. There’s not a lot of good cops coming out of that dirty furnace.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Don’t have to tell me. I went toe to toe with that Lucky Jack Flanagan long before I was teaching you. Never could make a charge stick on that guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bardot must have had a lot of fortitude to make it all the way over here.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: He was definitely driven. But he also had a tendency to let emotion to get the best of him. He’d rush into situations without thinking, and it had gotten worse the last couple of days.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: He kept fumbling a tactical drill he usually aced, so I pulled him aside and confronted him. He said he screwed something up in his personal life, he didn’t know what to do. I told him to cowboy up, set it right. Now I’m thinking he died trying to do just that.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY SHIPTON
utterance.content: You didn’t tell Kate what happened in Los Angeles? You chickened out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I did not chicken out, all right? I was interrupted. And now I’m wondering if it was a sign from the universe.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: What? The universe sent your mother to tell you what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Take my own advice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am erasing our mind for a reason. To protect Kate.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Okay. Enough. Go and talk to your wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If I hadn’t wiped my memory, Beckett’s friends at the AG’s office might still be alive. What if she can’t forgive me?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: That decision’s not yours to make, Rick.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What? Bardot’s room is huge compared to the one I lived in. That thing was barely a closet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I never really bunked on campus. I got enough of communal living when I was in the army, and besides, you can’t really bring a ménage of cop groupies home to a dorm room.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL DECKER
utterance.content: What are you doing in here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re investigating a homicide. Who are you?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Recruit Officer Rachel Decker.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did you know Daniel Bardot?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Yes, sir. He was in my training company.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know what he was doing last night?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: No, sir. We invited him to go out with us but he begged off. Sir, if there’s any way I can help with this investigation, I want in.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: You forget your place, Decker? You’re not even a lowly uniform. What could you possibly offer these distinguished detectives?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Insight. Did you train along Officer Bardot?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Yes, ma’am.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you forged a bond with him against the evil Sergeant Ortiz, which means you have information on Bardot that his higher ups do not, is that correct, recruit?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So tell me, what was he struggling with? What did he need to set right?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: I don’t know. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Way to face plant in front of a superior, Decker. This is Captain Beckett.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Captain, I –

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: You’re dismissed, recruit!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was a little harsh, don’t you think?

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: I do not. Being put in her place is exactly what Decker needs. She’s the real deal. Her name could very well be on all of your trophies by the time she’s done here. But she desperately needs to learn a little humility.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, you find anything in the autopsy?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I did. The bullet broke up when it hit a rib. Bardot’s killer didn’t get all the pieces. I managed to pull a small fragment from a kidney. I got a ballistics match. The 9mm that fired it is in the database. Kate, it’s NYPD. Registered to the Academy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The murder weapon is missing from the weapons cage assigned to Bardot’s company, company thirty eight.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The lock on the CCTV security closet was jimmied open. Someone killed the security cams in the weapons room between 7:30 and 7:35 last night.

utterance.speaker: MALONE
utterance.content: At that hour it’s mainly recruits left in the building. All faculty resides off campus. And only members of company thirty eight has access to that weapons cage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So our killer is one of Bardot’s fellow recruits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fourteen suspects who eat, drink, and sleep police training and techniques.

utterance.speaker: DAVE CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Captain on deck!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who spent months learning how we catch killers. Which makes them uniquely equipped to plan a murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we are going to have to use every trick in the book to uncover who killed Daniel Bardot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At ease, officers. Take a seat.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Company thirty eight, this is Captain Beckett of the Twelfth Precinct. Because of last night’s tragic event she will be joining us today as a special guest instructor. Respect her or your ass will meet my boot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Sergeant. First of all, let me assure you that I have the best NYPD detectives looking into Officer Bardot’s murder. That being said, this is not going to be the last time that you lose one of your coworkers. That is a reality of this job. The temptation is going to be to remain stoic in the face of adversity. To lock up your emotions so as not to appear weak. That is a mistake. Avoid that temptation at all costs, trust me. I have been on the edge of that map and monsters lie there. Now look around. This is your team. No one is going to understand what you are feeling better than the woman or man sitting next to you, so use them. Officer Chambers, I’m very sorry about the loss of your fellow recruit. How do you feel?

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: The city lost a great cop, ma’am. We should all aspire to be a guardian of justice like he was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that a PR statement for the Post? One of your brothers was gunned down. I asked you how you felt.

utterance.speaker: JANE LOPEZ
utterance.content: We feel pissed off, Captain.

utterance.speaker: STEVE TAKATA
utterance.content: Yeah. Set us loose. Let us track down the son of a b*tch who did this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, Officer Decker already volunteered her services for that very role.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: The offer still stands, Captain. And frankly, I didn’t become a cop to get in touch with my feelings. I’m here because bad people exist in the world and I can’t wait to start putting them in prison where they belong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, get ready for a training session.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: I just checked the front gate log. Ten of the recruits were off campus at the time of Bardot’s murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, well, these three all have the same hand stamp. The club across the street had a sign from last night offering karaoke, so I’m going to have my detectives run those photos over there, but I’m guessing they’re going to alibi out.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Leaving these seven.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: You know, if word gets out that these recruits are suspects it’ll haunt their careers. Even if proved innocent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, we need to keep it to a tight circle.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: What’s the next move?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I think it’s a safe bet that if one of these seven killed Bardot, it was their first murder and unless they’re a complete psychopath, which the psych eval would have revealed, that they spent a long, dark night at the soul, reliving the recoil of the gun and the knife cutting into Bardot’s body to get that bullet out.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Meaning what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Meaning they’re on a razor’s edge. And I want to put them in a high stress simulation and watch them shoot a gun.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Lopez, Takada, you’re up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There. That pause. What was that?

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Hate to break it to you, but that’s normal for Takada. Guy’s got a hitch in his giddyup I cannot cure.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Decker, Chambers, you’re up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about Decker? The other recruits don’t seem to like her.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Every recruit’s got a problem with Decker. She’s ultra focused, competitive as hell, and is walled off from everyone. Kind of like you were.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a second. Bardot’s tactical gear. We didn’t find it in his dorm room.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: No, we put lockers in so they could keep it here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And which locker is Bardot’s?

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Seven.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Am I witnessing one of Kate Beckett’s famous hunches?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The lab couldn’t pull any prints off of that blue index card. We’ve got our handwriting expert comparing it against samples from the other suspects, but he’s not optimistic given the block letters.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Is that Beckett?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let me holler at her. Beckett, hey. You remember that phone call that Bardot made to that Midtown law firm the day he died? Yeah, I went over there, only no one remembers the call. So without more to go on it looks like a dead end. Yeah, I’ll keep you posted.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett’s not here. She’s at the Police Academy working a high profile murder. One of the recruit officers was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a little close to home. These the suspects?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and three more recruits just alibied out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your victim was killed by a fellow recruit?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Appears so, and word is these four were watching the fights at a local boxing gym at the time of the murder, but that alibi’s soft.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Just spoke with Liz from Vice. The boxing gym is a notorious hotpot for illegal steroids. Rumor has it that one of the trainers was dealing to a cop at the Academy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the victim, Bardot, stumbled onto a dirty cop.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, that would explain the threatening note, “dead men tell no tales”.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Bardot wouldn’t back down so the cop kills him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was the name of the cop who was dealing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Arthur Stenson. Today’s not your lucky day.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s actually the complete opposite of your lucky day.

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR STENSON
utterance.content: Look, man, I don’t know what people been telling you, but I don’t sell drugs.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, really? Because that’s exactly what they’ve been telling us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And the stash that we found hidden in the false bottom of your locker confirms it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So here’s the deal. We say nice things about you to the DA, maybe get you a suspended sentence, if you give up that cop you’ve been dealing to at the Academy.

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR
utterance.content: I can’t.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I guess we’re done here, then. Say hi to the jury for us.

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR
utterance.content: I can’t because we’ve never met! All right? Look. The cop puts cash in the locker, I pick it up, I leave the drugs. That’s it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So how do you know you’re dealing to a police officer?

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR
utterance.content: The buyer only arranges pickups on police appreciation nights. The NYPD doesn’t pay a cover. The gym’s crawling with cops.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How does the buyer contact you?

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR
utterance.content: They shove an index card in my locker. The note says when they want delivery.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hold on. A blue index card?

utterance.speaker: ARTHUR
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think I know how Beckett can smoke out our killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The thing about interviewing a suspect is you have to find what works for you. Your own personal style. Now, some people like good cop/bad cop, others like bad cop/worse cop. But choosing just one method is a mistake. Every suspect is different and sometimes you don’t know how you’re going to go at them until they start talking. Because you only get one shot in interrogation and if you screw it up – – a killer might walk free. So, I want to try something. I need a volunteer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Lopez. Right over here. Miss Lopez, thank you for coming in.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Anything I can do to help the NYPD.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So a crime was committed last night and your name was mentioned. I was wondering if you could tell me where you were.

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Sure. I went to the fights over at Harry’s Gym.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhm. You go alone?

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: No, Takada, Chambers, Decker, we all went.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You have anything to drink?

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: Yeah, we had a few drinks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How many?

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: I don’t remember. What’s in the bag?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: LOPEZ
utterance.content: I don’t know. You put it on the table. It must mean something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Decker! Take her place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was Miss Lopez telling the truth? Were you out last night?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And were the four of you out together all night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t look at them. Look at me. Were the four of you together all night watching the fight?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: No. Uh, Lopez and Takada left early. Chambers was still there when I left, which was right before the last fight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know what a PED is?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s a performance enhancing drug.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Chambers. Take Decker’s place.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where’re you running to, recruit?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You don’t want to miss the rest of Captain’s lecture, do you? Turn over.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ready to earn some extra credit?

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: I want a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, you better get a good one. Juries don’t like cop killers.

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Wait, you think I popped Bardot?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found a stack of identical cards in your dorm room desk.

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You sent that to Bardot because he found that out you were dealing drugs.

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Fine. You want in on a bet?

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: On what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: On you. You’re not cooperating so I’m taking protective custody off the table, and a bunch of us are wagering on how long you’re going to last once the inmates find out that you’re a cop. I’m guessing under twelve hours and I’m feeling really lucky right now.

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Wait. Can I make a deal?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Depends. Start talking.

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Look, the fights didn’t let out until after Bardot was murdered. Witnesses can verify I was there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So why did you threaten him?

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Bardot caught me with my stash the morning that he was killed. I sent the note hoping to keep him from ratting me out, only Bardot wasn’t intimidated. But he offered a deal; five grand for his silence. Apparently he was desperate for cash. So I paid up and he flagged a cab to the city.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why did he need the money so urgently?

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Beats me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nah. You’re going to have to do better than that.

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: I don’t know! But if anyone does it’d be his girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Does his girlfriend have a name?

utterance.speaker: CHAMBERS
utterance.content: Recruit officer Decker.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I used to come here between classes, too. I always enjoyed the extra practice. Except a mannequin doesn’t resist arrest.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: I got it, Captain. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Show me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can I make a suggestion?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: I tripped, okay? I got it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shut up and listen, recruit. You might actually learn something. Turn around. Now, the fact that you’re a woman is an advantage, especially over men. You have a lower center of gravity so use it. Drop into your hips and then pull him past the tipping point. Got it? Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Once the chest goes through the rest will follow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Try it? All right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good. You’re a quick study.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Thanks, Captain.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ve got the murder weapon. Dumpster diver found it buried in a bag of garbage. The gun was wiped clean but not the rounds in the magazine. Check this out. The prints are a match to Bardot’s.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If Bardot loaded it then he had to have been the one who stole it from the Academy. So he was shot with his own gun?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Question is, what was he doing with it out there in the first place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Academy is a stressful place. Plenty of pressures here. Especially since one mistake can put a stink on an entire cop career. Like, uh, getting caught fraternizing with another recruit.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Are you going to have me booted?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. But I need you to be on the up and up with me from now on.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Of course. Anything you want to know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Officer Bardot leveraged Chambers for five grand. Apparently he needed that money urgently. Do you know why?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: No, no clue. I swear. Look, the truth is, Danny was hiding something from me. He had been going out the last few nights, which was really unlike him. He’d slip into my room late, said he’d been out for a midnight jog but, I mean, I knew that was total BS because when he came in he wasn’t tired, he wasn’t sweaty. He just always smelled like rotten fish.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Yeah. It was weird. I asked him about it. He said he accidentally stepped in garbage on his run. But if that was the case then –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why did he smell like rotten fish every night?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sweet and spicy shrimp?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where from?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Chinatown. Across the street from the back alley computer repair shop where Bardot was dropped with five grand burning a hole in his pocket.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was he doing there?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Owner refused to talk when I showed her his photo. So I looked into her. Word is, she deals in black market software and hardware. Bardot may have bought something from her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wonder why. Let’s get Bardot’s laptop to Vikram, have him run a deeper search.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Decker’s tip on Bardot’s shoes paid off. The lab identified wild Scottish salmon scales on the soles. And only three fish markets import Scottish salmon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s the same neighborhood as the crime scene, and apparently Bardot went there on consecutive nights.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ll canvass the fish market, see if we can find out what he was up to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were right. I uncovered the real reason I had my memories erased, and it’s bad. I knew about LokSat a year and a half ago. Before your AG team was murdered, before Vikram sought you out and his squads came gunning. Beckett, this was on me before it was on you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You knew about LokSat? Everything? Including their connection to Bracken? And you chose to forget this? Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For reasons you know all too well. I was trying to protect you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From yourself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, Captain. Uh … we found something you need to see.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll be right there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I need time to process this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We found street cam footage of Bardot before he was killed. This is Bardot an hour before he was murdered walking past the fish market, which is right across the alley from a lingerie wholesaler. It’s a known front for Jack Flanagan, aka Lucky Jack. He’s the mafia boss who runs Hunt’s Point.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bardot grew up in Hunt’s Point.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Check this out. The law firm that Bardot contacted? They represent Jack Flanagan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bardot was communicating to Flanagan through a third party so it couldn’t be traced.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And it gets better. Show her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Our victim was in league with the Irish mafia.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Flanagan must have planted Bardot in the NYPD as his mole. For all we know he’s been grooming Bardot since he was a kid in the old neighborhood.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What I don’t get is if Bardot was working for Flanagan why did Bardot bring a gun to the meeting?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Protection. Ortiz said that Bardot was looking to set something right. He had second thoughts about being the mole for Flanagan and then Flanagan killed him for it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was trying to protect you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From who?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From yourself.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bardot’s computer. Vikram found a hidden folder that contains every NYPD file of Flanagan and his crew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Surveillance photos, wiretaps, CIs. Everything that Flanagan would need to stay one step ahead of the police.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But how did Bardot hack in to the NYPD secured network? It’s hardwired into select department computers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Including the computer in Commissioner Malone’s office at the Academy. Bardot must have snuck into Malone’s office, used a portable password cracker on it – that’s what he got at the black market with the five grand he squeezed out of Chambers.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Flanagan used Bardot to get these files. After he got them he turned on his own mole.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bardot must have seen the double cross coming. He pulled his gun, they fought, Flanagan got the upper hand and he shot Bardot in the back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let’s dig into Flanagan, see if we can corroborate this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You want us to pick him up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nope. Not yet. I’m going to have a sit down with Lucky Jack, see if I can rattle his cage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you deny that Bardot supplied you with confidential NYPD files?

utterance.speaker: JACK FLANAGAN
utterance.content: Absolutely. With prejudice. That kid came in here looking for a job as a lingerie salesman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bardot was working for you. And I’m going to prove that you killed him.

utterance.speaker: FLANAGAN
utterance.content: Twenty years. Twenty years you guys have been coming in here with all these accusations against old Lucky Jack. The problem is that none of you ever followed up with the proof. So … unless you’re here to buy a pair of crotchless panties for that special someone in your life I suggest you grab your hat and books and you get the hell out of my store.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: See, that’s how I know I’m going to take you down. It’s the cocky ones that are the easiest. You’re so busy being clever you don’t see the matchstick falling out of your pocket. Well, I’m going to find that matchstick. And then I’m going to burn you with it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did we end up here again? You lie to protect me, I lie to protect you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not going to yell. Or throw around blame.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, the novelist George Sand, who was a woman, by the way, once wrote, “Lying, like license, has its degrees” -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stop talking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So if we’re not talking, what are we doing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Captain! Captain. Looks like Jack Flanagan’s reach goes deeper inside the Academy than just Bardot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, one of the recruits went to college on a scholarship awarded by a trust created by Flanagan’s law firm. Now, that scholarship was financed by Flanagan himself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Flanagan has a second mole in the Police Academy? Who?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: I am not his mole! And neither was Danny!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found the police files that he hacked into and then handed over to Flanagan.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Oh no. No, no, no. Danny must have made a deal in order to save me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Save you from what?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: The man that knocked up my mother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re Flanagan’s daughter?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: A one night stand does not make him a parent. It makes him a donor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You took his blood money.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: He and my mother had an arrangement: staying quiet on my paternity in exchange for monthly payouts to her and a college fund for me. But that was it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why did Bardot need to save you?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: A few weeks ago Flanagan found out that I’d joined the Academy. He demanded that I be his inside woman. His mole. Threatened to out me as his daughter if I didn’t. Ruin my entire career before it even began.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because no cop will ever trust Lucky Jack’s kid.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: I panicked. I ended up opening up to Danny. He was the one that talked me off the edge. Told me that Flanagan was bluffing. I had no idea he was going to offer himself up in my place. What do I do, Captain?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There is only one move that you can make. Do you want to arrests Bardot’s killer? Bring down Flanagan? Something the NYPD hasn’t done for twenty years? You’re the one person Flanagan might open up to. You need to wear a wire.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, you get into trouble what are you going to say? Decker?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Panic phrase.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Oh, um… I could really use a drink right now. Do you have any Scotch?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly. You say that and we’re going to rush right in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re going to be fine.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You really think she’s ready for this, Cap? Not everybody is as strong as you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll be damned if Flanagan makes her. He won’t hesitate to put a bullet in her skull.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She can handle this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, come on. You got it.

utterance.speaker: FLANAGAN
utterance.content: The prodigal daughter returns. You know, I am a bit surprised to see you, considering last time we spoke I think you told me to screw myself, right? Why am I blessed with your presence on this day, huh? Come on, speak up, child.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You got it. Nice and slow.

utterance.speaker: FLANAGAN
utterance.content: Speak.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: You know, it didn’t have to play out this way. It was one thing to ask me to be your rat. But when the man I loved volunteered and delivered? Why did you kill Danny?

utterance.speaker: FLANAGAN
utterance.content: You know, it’s funny. You’re the second lady cop in as many days to stand there and accuse me of said crime. Funny.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Damn it, she’s made.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They’re going to smoke her, Captain.

utterance.speaker: FLANAGAN
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: I’m not afraid of you anymore.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where the hell did she get a gun?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Now admit to killing Danny or I will end you.

utterance.speaker: FLANAGAN
utterance.content: Look, I had nothing to do with your boyfriend’s murder.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: For once in your miserable life own up to what you did!

utterance.speaker: FLANAGAN
utterance.content: I’m not lying!

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: I don’t believe you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Police!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Decker, look at me. I said, look at me! You can take him down. Just not like this. You are not him. Put the gun down.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: As soon as you start telling the truth.

utterance.speaker: FLANAGAN
utterance.content: Come on, Captain, do something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Flanagan! Start talking!

utterance.speaker: FLANAGAN
utterance.content: Okay – – your boyfriend has a set of balls on him. I mean, he marches in here and tells me to back down. And you know what I do? I say sure. But you got to do a little something for me, okay? Now, your boy comes through, we shake hands, and that’s it.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Then who killed him?

utterance.speaker: FLANAGAN
utterance.content: I don’t know who killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he mention having problems with anyone?

utterance.speaker: FLANAGAN
utterance.content: No, no, no. Look, um … when he left this car started down the street. Now, for a minute I thought maybe he was being tailed. It was a dark sedan. Now that’s it. That’s it, I swear.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s telling the truth. Stand down. Stand down.

utterance.speaker: FLANAGAN
utterance.content: Look at that. You are more like me than you know.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You are a hot mess. I take it your talk with Beckett last night went well?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Less of a discussion, more of an Irish intervention.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So you just sat around drinking whiskey and avoiding the subject.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. But I can tell she’s still upset with me. She left this morning without waking me.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: So what do you plan on doing about that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Well, that has to be the stupidest thing I’ve heard all day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am holding onto the thin hope that Beckett can find it in her heart to forgive me.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Rick! Come on! Stop moping about. Go do something about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? Have Beckett’s memory wiped?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No. We track down LokSat. Our west coast adventure yielded fruit. We have a window of time in which LokSat arrived in L.A. If we scrub the identities of everyone who landed in any area airport, be it public or private, then sooner or later we’ll find our target. I can start now. Just say the word.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not making any more decisions concerning LokSat without Beckett.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Now that is the smartest thing I’ve heard all day!

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Oh, I’m so sorry! Okay, I’ll get more aspirin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You are not quitting!

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: I’m unfit to be a cop, Captain. If you hadn’t talked me down back there … I had every intention of pulling that trigger.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you didn’t. You regained your wits. You made the right decision. And that’s what counts. There was a point in my career where I wanted to quit. I lost faith that I became a cop for the right reason.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: How did you get your faith back?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A man named Roy Montgomery helped me. He was my captain and he didn’t give up on me and I’m not giving up on you. So don’t let your father define who you are.

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: I have been trying to outrun him my entire life. I’m tired of running. I’m going to head back to the Academy, clean out my room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Decker’s quitting.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Oh. It’s always disappointing. It happens.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Not to recruits like her. Not on my watch.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan, check this out. Flanagan was telling the truth. Street cam caught this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A dark sedan that was following Bardot after he left Flanagan’s. Can’t make out the driver, though.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: But you can make out the plate.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who is this registered to?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s one of ours. Issued to the Police Academy motor pool.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Oh, come on, Beckett. Just because she’s got good scores doesn’t mean she’ll make a good cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’d put her on the street before any of the other recruits I met.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Espo, what’ve you got? Okay. Who’s the car registered to?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Thanks for the update.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Everything all right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Put your weapon down. Now.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: You lost your damn mind, Beckett? What’re you doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Damn it, Ortiz! Don’t make this harder than it needs to be! I know what you did.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: What, you think I killed Bardot?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You suspected that Bardot was working for Flanagan so you followed him. And then when you found out he was a mole you took him out.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Where’re you getting this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We tracked your service vehicle.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: I – I haven’t used that car for days. I lent it to –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t move. You okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it was you, Malone? Why? Why didn’t you just turn Bardot over to IA?

utterance.speaker: MALONE
utterance.content: I couldn’t! Not after what he found.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your office computer. He found something when he hacked into it.

utterance.speaker: MALONE
utterance.content: Caught my hand in the cookie jar. Forty years I protected this city. And the thanks I got? Three busted marriages and a handful of debt. Took what I was owed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It doesn’t have to end like this.

utterance.speaker: MALONE
utterance.content: Actually it does.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to draw him away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just give up, Malone! My detectives are on to you.

utterance.speaker: MALONE
utterance.content: No, they’re onto Ortiz.

utterance.speaker: MALONE
utterance.content: Damn it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what are you going to do, Malone? Kill me and stage it like Ortiz did it? Say you shot him in self-defense?

utterance.speaker: MALONE
utterance.content: Good plan, huh? They ought to give me a medal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Peek-a-boo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sarge. I thought we finally got rid of you.

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Oh, it’s going to take more than a bullet to put me down for the long dirt nap.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, you best heal up quick. You got a new batch of recruits coming in a few weeks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right, Sarge. We’ll get you out of here. Medic?

utterance.speaker: ORTIZ
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. How’re you holding up?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Well, we caught Danny’s killer but Lucky Jack Flanagan’s still free.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, his time will come. Stay with the NYPD and you can help with that. But you can’t keep going at it alone. Do you want to be a cop? Or not?

utterance.speaker: DECKER
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I can’t do this anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good. Neither can I.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, what are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I asked first.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I asked second. So you should answer first and I’ll answer second.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ok – okay. I can’t sit on the sidelines anymore where LokSat is concerned. People have lost their lives and in a way I am culpable. And I know you are trying to protect me but … I am begging you not to. I want in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good. Because I need you in. This is our fight now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, then there’s something you should know. That mystery bullet wound that I got when I disappeared. I was shot in Los Angeles. Two hours before I took that bullet, LokSat came to town arriving by plane.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, okay … there are three major airports along with dozens of private ones in the Los Angeles area. We’re talking tens of thousands of people. But maybe Vikram can whittle that number down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re looking for a needle in a stack of needles, but LokSat is one of those needles. What do you say, Beckett? It’s a place to start.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. This is.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
